paragraphs.name: 0d0f
paragraphs.text: And then the tears finally come.

a22cc6adc735.title: I’ve been staring at this box weeping for a couple minutes now.

paragraphs.text: I’ve been staring at this box weeping for a couple minutes now. These tears always wrap around the dread of my own parents’ exit. I am petrified by it.
paragraphs.name: c316

paragraphs.text: I’m very sorry for your loss. <<< These words are too shallow. Thanks for the beautiful writing. Peace and comfort to you.
paragraphs.name: dbb9

9672746b1ad0.title: Thank you so much for sharing this.

paragraphs.text: Thank you so much for sharing this. I know how difficult it is but it helps others dealing with the same situation (like me) more than you know. God bless you and your family.
paragraphs.name: 6d2c

1ecca9a5c114.title: Thank you for sharing your pain with us.

paragraphs.text: Thank you for sharing your pain with us.
paragraphs.name: 1bb8

paragraphs.text: We lost my dad this March the third, but unexpectedly.
I didn’t realize how devastating it would be for a parent to suddenly just not be here anymore.
paragraphs.name: 5c52

paragraphs.text: I’m so sorry for your loss.
Peace to you and yours. ❤

5e65f94f9b09.title: Thank you so very much for sharing….your

paragraphs.text: Thank you so very much for sharing….your wife is very special…she just knew sending you that picture and those words would somehow help you put everything into focus.

f0bd7839609e.title: A gorgeous, beautiful and painful story.

paragraphs.text: A gorgeous, beautiful and painful story. The picture of your mother holding you juxtaposed with your description of holding her is staggering in its beauty and sorrow.
paragraphs.name: 993e

paragraphs.text: Thank God for hospice and the ability to more humanely be midwifed into the next world.

paragraphs.text: Eric, much love, blessings, prayers, and peace for you and yours. May your mother Rest In Peace for eternity. Thank you for sharing this with all of us. For allowing us to be a part of this journey.

db50dfeb807f.title: My mother died 14 yeas ago today.

paragraphs.text:
My mother died 14 yeas ago today. At home with hospice care. Her last words just hours before she died were “I am so blessed.” What an honor it was to be with her, along with my father and sister, when she eased across the curtain. 
Thank you for sharing your loss. We grow with one another when we share our losses.
paragraphs.name: 434c

d43925d8a40c.title: Death is not the only word we say here

paragraphs.text: Death is not the only word we say here
paragraphs.name: previewTitle

paragraphs.text: Your final day of hospice
paragraphs.name: previewSubtitle

virtuals.subtitle: Your final day of hospice
virtuals.metaDescription: The first thing I did today was change the calendar in your room from March to April. Now it shows a photo of a cherry tree in full bloom, pink and wide and sagging under all that new life…

content.subtitle: Your final day of hospice
content.metaDescription: The first thing I did today was change the calendar in your room from March to April. Now it shows a photo of a cherry tree in full bloom, pink and wide and sagging under all that new life…

paragraphs.text: Yes. They are here.

46973344cd3d.title: Eric, Thank You SO much for sharing this story.

paragraphs.text: Eric, Thank You SO much for sharing this story. It touched me in ways I haven’t been touched in a very long time. I’ve made this same journey (though not in a hospice) many times. My father’s family were all in their forties and fifties when I was born.
paragraphs.name: 4b0f

virtuals.subtitle: But the love, the caring, the concern in your writing, reached cross time and space. For that I’m greatful.

content.subtitle: But the love, the caring, the concern in your writing, reached cross time and space. For that I’m greatful.

8947abc4f124.title: And then the tears finally come.

paragraphs.text: And then the tears finally come.
I suspect tears came for many of your readers, too. They did for me.
